00l8 | QR Factorisation. The next step in the MINRES procedure is to solve fourteen by computing the full QR factorisation Qt Tt equals Rt where Qt in R(t plus one) by(t plus one) and Rt in R(t plus one) by t. Because It is already close to being upper triangular, we form the QR factorisation using a series of Householder reflections to annihilate the sub-diagonal elements. Each Householder reflection affects only two rows of Tt. We can summarise the effect of two successive Householder reflections
